data.text: @MonicaGandhi9 @CDCgov How are hospitalizations higher than symptomatic illness for 50+ years old? Were they hospitalized for not having symptoms? Why would you be hospitalized if nothing was apparently wrong?
@MonicaGandhi9 @CDCgov Wish I was surprised. And they wonder why people don’t trust their data! Ha. I have so many examples just like this from @MarinHHS too
@ish_biochemist @MonicaGandhi9 @CDCgov So a mortality rate of 80% of the 10% of those infected @ 65 and older?
@ish_biochemist @MonicaGandhi9 @CDCgov I mean, it isn't, but if that is what they meant it would also be extremely false (in fact even moreso)

@MonicaGandhi9 @CDCgov The only question here is: was this intentional to spread more fear and push vaccines on kids or was this sheer stupidity?  Given what we've seen from the @CDCgov , I'm guessing it was the former.  As of right now, it's still not fixed.  Credibility all but lost at this point.

@Megmd514 @MonicaGandhi9 @CDCgov @CDCDirector Where does the CDC make this distinction and recommendation? Would appreciate if you can provide the root source. I thought they were recommended specifically that schools follow the same as community guidelines. See the CDC Media Telebriefing on Friday, 2/25/22 below: https://t.co/567RKffHCr

@MonicaGandhi9 @CDCgov Can you also get a clarification from @CDCDirector @CDCgov why children under 5 still are recommended to wear a mask- but children over 5 are not - despite no difference in vaccination status, and possibly lower risk of infection in younger group? Not to mention rhe efficacy....
@MonicaGandhi9 @CDCgov Sincerely asking, would you provide a review of the recently released Pfizer vaccine data? It appears there is missing information and very concerning reactions. Thanks.
